questions.questionText: If tan 2A = cot (A - 18°) where 2A is an acute angle, find the value of A.
questions.referenceAnswer: tan 2A = cot (A - 18°) implies 2A = 90 - (A - 18), solve for A = 36

detailedAnalysis.mathematicalSteps: Step 1: Set equation tan 2A = cot (A - 18°) ✓, Step 2: Solve 2A = 90 - (A - 18) ✓, Step 3: A = 36 ✓
detailedAnalysis.suggestions: Ensure clarity in each algebraic step.

questions.questionText: Length of the shadow of a 15 meter high pole is 5√3 meters at 7 o'clock in the morning, then what is the angle of elevation of the sun rays with the ground at the time.

detailedAnalysis.mathematicalSteps: Step 1: tan θ = 15/5√3 ✓, Step 2: Simplify to √3 ✓, Step 3: θ = 60° ✓
detailedAnalysis.suggestions: Review trigonometric ratios for different angles.

questions.questionText: Check whether the given pair of equations represent intersecting, parallel or coincident lines.
questions.referenceAnswer: Compare coefficients: a1/a2 ≠ b1/b2, hence intersecting lines.

detailedAnalysis.studentWork: a1/a2 = 5/7, b1/b2 = -4/6, a1/a2 ≠ b1/b2, intersecting lines
detailedAnalysis.mathematicalSteps: Step 1: Calculate a1/a2 = 5/7 ✓, Step 2: Calculate b1/b2 = -4/6 ✓, Step 3: Compare and conclude intersecting ✓
detailedAnalysis.suggestions: Practice more on identifying line relationships.
